intro: Tarphochlamys, commonly known as the false bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Campanulaceae. It is characterized by its bell-shaped or tubular flowers, which are typically blue or violet in color. The plants are herbaceous and often grow in moist, woodland habitats. They have opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produce small, capsule-like fruits. Tarphochlamys species are primarily found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
